column4: ut obituary guestbook services flowers photos back to top obituary. beloved son
column5: brother and uncle. steven gregg shepard
column8: 2015. he will be deeply missed by those who loved him. steve was born january 1
column10: utah. he was a lifelong resident of murray and after he graduated from murray high school he attended the university of utah for 3 years
column11: he then decided to become an electrician and follow his brother
column12: scott's example and finished his studies at slcc. steve was married to brandy agulara
column13: later divorced. steve brought many happy memories for those who were with him doing his favorite things such as boating
column15: fishing and playing ball. steve had a kind heart and was always helping others. he loved playing with his nieces and nephews. in fact
column16: at most family gatherings you could always find him playing with the kids! he is survived by his mother and step-father
column20: rick (alyse) and lori shepard; and 3 step brothers and one step sister
column24: and many nieces and nephews. he was preceded in death by his father
column25: kenneth shepard. the family would like to express their thanks to lori for the time
column27: and the loving care she provided to steve. service will be held at 1:00 p. m. monday
column32: where friends may call from 11:00-12:45 p. m. prior to services. burial to follow at elysian burial gardens
column34: millcreek. online condolences may be shared at www. jenkins-soffe. com. read steven shepard's obituary and guestbook on jenkins-soffe. com. back to top guestbook. leave your condolence. post message. anna lee so sorry to hear about steve. he was a great friend when we were young and you were always so good to me. the best to all your family. mark jeffs - about 12 hours ago back to top services. funeral home. jenkins-soffe mortuary-murray jenkins-soffe mortuary-murray4760 south state street. murray
